meanings.sent1: She tried to outfrown her brother's grumpy face.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outfrown others when he is upset.
meanings.sent3: The competition was fierce as they tried to outfrown each other.
meanings.sent4: Her deep scowl could outfrown even the gloomiest clouds.
meanings.sent5: His ability to outfrown everyone else made him the champion of the frown-off.

meanings.definition: To show disapproval or displeasure with a facial expression
meanings.sent1: Don't outfrown your friends when they make mistakes.
meanings.sent2: She would outfrown whenever someone mentioned her ex-boyfriend.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to outfrown the new cat in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her mother's disapproving look could outfrown anyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: He would always outfrown at the sight of litter on the streets.

meanings.definition: To have a more intense or severe frown than someone else
meanings.sent1: She could always outfrown her classmates during math tests.
meanings.sent2: He would outfrown at the smallest inconvenience.
meanings.sent3: The baby managed to outfrown even the grumpiest old man.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outfrown her opponents gave her an edge in negotiations.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds seemed to outfrown the sun, casting a shadow over the town.
